    26  func TestNewHttps(t *testing.T) {
    27  	TCPaddress := "127.0.0.1:0"
    28  	network := ""
    29  	var certDER parlca.CertificateDER
    30  	var signer crypto.Signer
    31  	hp := NewHttps(TCPaddress, network, certDER, signer)
    32  	_ = hp
    33  }
    34  
    35  func TestHttpsListen(t *testing.T) {
    36  	TCPaddress := "127.0.0.1:0"
    37  	network := ""
    38  	protocol := "https://"
    39  	URIPattern := "/"   // "/" matches everything
    40  	canonicalName := "" // ca common name, will default to {host}ca
    41  	// /usr/local/opt/openssl/bin/openssl x509 -in ca.der -inform der -noout -text
    42  	caCertFilename := filepath.Join(parlos.UserHomeDir(), "ca.der")
    43  	ownerRW := fs.FileMode(0o600)
    44  	// /usr/local/opt/openssl/bin/openssl pkey -in key.der -inform der -text -noout
    45  	keyFilename := filepath.Join(parlos.UserHomeDir(), "key.der")
    46  	// /usr/local/opt/openssl/bin/openssl x509 -in cert.der -inform der -noout -text
    47  	certFilename := filepath.Join(parlos.UserHomeDir(), "cert.der")
    48  	//commonName := "" // server certificate, will default to {host}
    49  	//subject := "subject"
    50  	IPv4loopback := net.IPv4(127, 0, 0, 1)
    51  	secs := 0 // 10
    52  	sleepDuration := time.Duration(secs) * time.Second
    53  
    54  	t.Log("Creating self-signed certificate authority")
    55  	caCert := parlca.NewSelfSigned(canonicalName)
    56  	writeFile(caCertFilename, caCert.DER(), ownerRW, t.Logf)
    57  	var isValid bool
    58  	var caX509 *x509.Certificate
    59  	isValid, caX509, err := caCert.Check()
    60  	if err != nil {
    61  		t.Error(err)
    62  		return
    63  	}
    64  	if !isValid {
    65  		t.Error(error116.New("ca Check failed"))
    66  		return
    67  	}
    68  
    69  	t.Log("Creating server private key")
    70  	serverKey, err := parlca.NewEd25519()
    71  	if err != nil {
    72  		t.Error(error116.Errorf("server parlca.NewEd25519: '%w'", err))
    73  		return
    74  	}
    75  	serverSigner := serverKey.Private()   // private key for running the server
    76  	serverPublic := serverSigner.Public() // public key for creating server certificate
    77  	var keyDER parlca.KeyDER
    78  	if keyDER, err = serverKey.Bytes(); err != nil {
    79  		t.Error(err)
    80  		return
    81  	}
    82  	writeFile(keyFilename, keyDER, ownerRW, t.Logf)
    83  
    84  	t.Log("Creating server certificate")
    85  	template := x509.Certificate{
    86  		IPAddresses: []net.IP{IPv4loopback, net.IPv6loopback},
    87  	}
    88  	parlca.EnsureServer(&template)
    89  	var certDER parlca.CertificateDER
    90  	if certDER, err = caCert.Sign(&template, serverPublic); err != nil {
    91  		t.Errorf("signing server certificate: %+v", err)
    92  		return
    93  	}
    94  	writeFile(certFilename, certDER, ownerRW, t.Logf)
    95  
    96  	t.Log("Starting server")
    97  	hp := NewHttps(TCPaddress, network, certDER, serverSigner)
    98  	//hp.HandleFunc(URIPattern, func(w http.ResponseWriter, req *http.Request) {
    99  	hp.HandleFunc(URIPattern, func(w http.ResponseWriter, req *http.Request) {
   100  		t.Logf("server received request from: %s", req.RemoteAddr)
   101  		w.WriteHeader(http.StatusNoContent)
   102  	})
   103  	// /usr/local/opt/openssl/bin/openssl s_client -connect 127.0.0.1:57984
   104  	errCh := hp.Listen()
   105  
   106  	// listen for errors
   107  	var errChWg sync.WaitGroup
   108  	errChWg.Add(1)
   109  	go func() {
   110  		defer errChWg.Done()
   111  		t.Log("Reading errCh")
   112  		err, ok := <-errCh
   113  		if !ok {
   114  			return // errCh closed
   115  		}
   116  		t.Errorf("errCh: %+v", err)
   117  		panic(err)
   118  	}()
   119  
   120  	var expectServerError bool
   121  	for once := true; once; once = false {
   122  
   123  		t.Logf("waiting for server ready")
   124  		isUp, addr := hp.WaitForUp()
   125  		if !isUp {
   126  			t.Log("hp.WaitForUp: Server failed to start")
   127  			expectServerError = true
   128  			break
   129  		}
   130  		t.Logf("Server listening at address: %s", addr.String())
   131  		if sleepDuration != 0 {
   132  			t.Logf("Sleep %d seconds", sleepDuration/time.Second)
   133  			time.Sleep(sleepDuration)
   134  		}
   135  
   136  		requestURL := protocol + addr.String()
   137  		t.Logf("Sending https request to %s", requestURL)
   138  		var resp *http.Response
   139  		if resp, err = Get(requestURL, NewTLSConfig(caX509), nil); err != nil {
   140  			expectServerError = true
   141  			t.Errorf("%+v", error116.Errorf("http.Get URL: %s: '%w'", requestURL, err))
   142  			break // expect there to be a server error
   143  		}
   144  
   145  		if resp.StatusCode != http.StatusNoContent {
   146  			t.Errorf("http.Get: bad status code from %s: %d expected: %d", requestURL, resp.StatusCode, http.StatusNoContent)
   147  			return
   148  		}
   149  		if err = resp.Body.Close(); err != nil {
   150  			t.Errorf("Body.Close: %+v", err)
   151  			return
   152  		}
   153  		t.Logf("response status code: %d", resp.StatusCode)
   154  	}
   155  
   156  	t.Logf("Shutting down server")
   157  	hp.Shutdown()
   158  
   159  	errChWg.Wait() // wait for errCh to close
   160  
   161  	if expectServerError {
   162  		panic(error116.New("Server provided no error")) // errCh should have paniced
   163  	}
   164  
   165  	t.Logf("Completed successfully")
   166  }
   167  
   168  func writeFile(filename string, bytes []byte, mode fs.FileMode, logf func(format string, args ...interface{})) {
   169  	if filename == "" {
   170  		return
   171  	}
   172  	logf("Writing: %s", filename)
   173  	if err := os.WriteFile(filename, bytes, mode); err != nil {
   174  		panic(error116.Errorf("os.WriteFile: '%w'", err))
   175  	}
   176  }
   177  
   178  func NewHttpsTypes() {
   179  	// http TLS methods
   180  	_ = http.ListenAndServeTLS
   181  	var s http.Server
   182  	_ = s.ListenAndServeTLS
   183  	_ = s.ServeTLS // has http/one-off 2 code
   184  	_ = s.Serve
   185  
   186  	// generic listener
   187  	var netListener net.Listener // interface, represents a listening file handle
   188  	_ = netListener.Accept       // func (net.Listener).Accept() (net.Conn, error)
   189  	_ = netListener.Addr         // func (net.Listener).Addr() net.Addr
   190  	_ = netListener.Close        // func (net.Listener).Close() error
   191  
   192  	// tcp listener
   193  	var tcp net.TCPListener // net.Listen listener type: *net.TCPListener
   194  	_ = tcp                 // has func (*net.TCPListener).Close() error
   195  
   196  	// TLS listener
   197  	// tls.NewListener wraps a listener to be TLS
   198  	_ = tls.NewListener // func tls.NewListener(inner net.Listener, config *tls.Config) net.Listener
   199  	// tls.NewListener requires tls.Config
   200  	// srv field TLSConfig *tls.Config, struct
   201  
   202  	// tls.Config
   203  	var tlsConfig tls.Config // struct
   204  	//_ = tlsConfig.BuildNameToCertificate // func (*tls.Config).BuildNameToCertificate()
   205  	_ = tlsConfig.Clone                // func (*tls.Config).Clone() *tls.Config
   206  	_ = tlsConfig.SetSessionTicketKeys // func (*tls.Config).SetSessionTicketKeys(keys [][32]byte)
   207  	_ = tlsConfig.Certificates         // field Certificates []tls.Certificate
   208  
   209  	// tls.Certificate
   210  	var tlsCertificate tls.Certificate // struct no methods
   211  	_ = tlsCertificate.PrivateKey      // field PrivateKey crypto.PrivateKey
   212  	// tlsCertificate.Certificate is a list of certificate DER bytes
   213  	_ = tlsCertificate.Certificate // field Certificate [][]byte
   214  	_ = tlsCertificate
   215  
   216  	// http.Server.ServeTLS loads credentials using tls.LoadX509KeyPair
   217  	_ = tls.LoadX509KeyPair // func tls.LoadX509KeyPair(certFile string, keyFile string) (tls.Certificate, error)
   218  	// tls.LoadX509KeyPair uses tls.X509KeyPair to create tls.Certificate
   219  	_ = tls.X509KeyPair // func tls.X509KeyPair(certPEMBlock []byte, keyPEMBlock []byte) (tls.Certificate, error)
   220  	// tls.X509KeyPair uses x509.ParseCertificate to create certificate from DER
   221  	_ = x509.ParseCertificate              // func x509.ParseCertificate(asn1Data []byte) (*x509.Certificate, error)
   222  	var x509Certificate x509.Certificate   // struct
   223  	_ = x509Certificate.CheckCRLSignature  // func (*x509.Certificate).CheckCRLSignature(crl *pkix.CertificateList) error
   224  	_ = x509Certificate.CheckSignature     // func (*x509.Certificate).CheckSignature(algo x509.SignatureAlgorithm, signed []byte, signature []byte) error
   225  	_ = x509Certificate.CheckSignatureFrom // func (*x509.Certificate).CheckSignatureFrom(parent *x509.Certificate) error
   226  	_ = x509Certificate.CreateCRL          // func (*x509.Certificate).CreateCRL(rand io.Reader, priv interface{}, revokedCerts []pkix.RevokedCertificate, now time.Time, expiry time.Time) (crlBytes []byte, err error)
   227  	_ = x509Certificate.Equal              // func (*x509.Certificate).Equal(other *x509.Certificate) bool
   228  	_ = x509Certificate.Verify             // func (*x509.Certificate).Verify(opts x509.VerifyOptions) (chains [][]*x509.Certificate, err error)
   229  	_ = x509Certificate.VerifyHostname     // func (*x509.Certificate).VerifyHostname(h string) error
   230  	_ = x509Certificate.Raw                // field Raw []byte
   231  	_ = x509Certificate
   232  	// tls.X509KeyPair assigns private key DER to cert.PrivateKey
   233  
   234  	// 220220 var tlsDial tls.Dial
   235  
   236  	var _ crypto.PrivateKey
   237  }
